column2: TX DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: Texas
column6: TX

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the right.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column8: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.

column2: 2. This sign indicates:
column4: Winding road
column6: Merging traffic

column2: 3. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: Driving within the range.
column6: Reduced visibility.
column10: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead; slow down to the indicated speed
column6: Divided highway begins. Slow down to the safe speed indicated
column8: The road ahead curves right; slow down to indicated speed
column10: Merge, then slow down to the safe speed indicated

column2: 5. The effects of alcohol on driving do NOT include:
column4: Improved judgement
column6: Better reflexes

column2: 6. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column4: of a headlight failure.
column6: of a brake failure.
column10: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 7. This sign means:
column4: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column6: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 8. When driving near light rail vehicles, drivers should:
column4: never drive around lowered crossing gates.
column6: expect trains on any track at any time.
column8: always obey signs and traffic signals.

column2: 9. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.
column6: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column8: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column10: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.

column2: 10. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column6: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column8: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.
column10: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.

column2: 11. The yield sign means:
column4: Stop.
column6: Go. The light will soon be red.
column10: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.

column2: 12. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Drinking coffee.
column6: Eating before or while you drink.
column8: Not drinking over a period of time.

column2: 13. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: they cannot go straight ahead.
column6: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.

column2: 14. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column6: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.
column8: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 15. This sign indicates:
column4: that you must not drive past this sign.
column6: the entrance to a dead-end street.
column8: that you must yield the right-of-way.
column10: the entrance to a construction site.

column2: 16. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs can:
column4: have a less pronounced effect than either taken separately.
column6: have a more pronounced effect than either taken separately.

column2: 17. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.
column6: Long-distance commuters.

column2: 18. When driving, it is important to keep a space cushion _______ of your vehicle.
column4: only in front
column6: only on the left and right side

column2: 19. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must not make a right turn.
column6: U-turns are not allowed.
column8: they must make a left turn at the intersection.

column2: 20. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the left.
column6: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column10: slow down and keep well to the right.

column2: 21. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column6: you are not allowed to park here.
column8: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column10: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 22. This sign is a:
column4: regulatory sign.
column6: stop sign.

column2: 23. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column6: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.

column2: 24. A steady yellow light means that a ______ light will soon appear.
column4: flashing yellow
column6: steady red

column2: 25. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
column6: leave more space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 26. Which of the following does NOT affect the distance that it takes to stop your vehicle?
column4: Reaction distance.
column6: Braking distance.

column2: 27. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
column4: Run away.
column6: Do not move.

column2: 28. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column6: Motorcycles are hard to see.
column8: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.

column2: 29. Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
column4: yellow
column6: black

column2: 30. The picture shows:
column4: a reversible road sign.
column6: a railroad advance warning sign.
